articles.title: UFC 321 overreactions, plus Topuria vs. Pimblett THE fight to make! | ORT
articles.description: "Overreaction Time" (Tuesdays, noon ET) is a weekly podcast hosted by MMA Junkie managing editor Simon Samano where he shares his "overreactions" with an MMA Junkie staff member, and the debate begins! On this edition, he and MMA Junkie senior reporter Mike Bohn discuss the following: (00:00) - Intro (01:12) - Ciryl Gane‚Äôs eye poke probably saved Tom Aspinall from defeat? (06:12) - Everyone blaming Tom Aspinall for ‚Äútaking the easy way out‚Äù can f*ck right off. (18:12) - Mackenzie Dern won‚Äôt make it through 2026 as UFC strawweight champion. (24:20) - Umar Nurmagomedov won‚Äôt be UFC bantamweight champion as long as Merab is around. (24:20) - Quillan Salkilld delivered the SCARIEST knockout of 2025. (27:55) - Ilia Topuria vs. Paddy Pimblett is the fight to make, and it should headline the UFC‚Äôs first numbered event on Paramount+. articles.title: Aspinall HOT TAKE! + Jones vs. Pereira = Biggest HW fight of ALL TIME? | Good Guy / Bad Guy
articles.description: On this episode of Good Guy / Bad Guy‚Ä¶The Bad Guy is doubling down on his now viral comments that Tom Aspinall should have continued fighting after being poked in the eyes by Cyril Gane. But does DC agree with the hot take that ruffled feathers across the MMA community? Then, there‚Äôs a new Women‚Äôs Strawweight Champion of the world and her name is Mackenzie Dern! DC breaks down his heartfelt moment with Dern and her daughter that gave fight fans all the feels. Plus, is she making the right move calling for the likes of Tatiana Suarez or Zhang Weili as her next opponent? And, Jon Jones says he‚Äôs down to fight Alex Pereira at the White House. Find out if the guys believe this could be the biggest Heavyweight title fight in UFC history. articles.title: Gane Gets Another Shot ‚Äî Is Aspinall Still the Heavy Favorite?
articles.description: Start fresh at https://tryfum.com/products/zero-crisp-mint. Over 500,000 people have already made the switch ‚Äî no nicotine, no vapor, no batteries. Just flavor, fidget, and a fresh start. UFC 321's main event ended in controversy as Tom Aspinall's first title defense against Ciryl Gane was halted due to an accidental eye poke. Despite the no-contest outcome, the question remains: Is Aspinall still the favorite in a potential rematch? In this video, Chael Analyzes the fight's dynamics, examining Aspinall's striking power and Gane's defensive skills. We also discuss the psychological impact on both fighters and speculate on how the betting odds might shift for a future bout. Join us as we break down the key moments and what they mean for the heavyweight division. articles.title: Ciryl Gane on people SLEEPING ON HIM vs. Tom Aspinall, BAD loss to Jones | Daniel Cormier Check-In
articles.description: Ciryl Gane IS BACK on another episode of the Daniel Cormier Check-In series ahead of the TOUGHEST FIGHT of his career against UFC heavyweight champion Tom Aspinall. DC and Ciryl break down the Jon Jones first-round submission loss, and what went wrong for him that night. Cormier and Gane also compare Tom to his past opponents, and Ciryl explains why fighting guys like Francis Ngannou and Derrick Lewis will make the fight WAY TOUGHER for Aspinall. And don't miss the guys talk shoe sizes, his strategy on Saturday night in the main event of UFC 321 in Abu Dhabi, and so much more! The Mackenzie Dern vs. Virna Jandiroba strawweight title fight at UFC 321 is being widely described as the most insignificant title fight in recent UFC history, according to Din Thomas. The title was left vacant by Zhang Weili moving up to fight for the flyweight belt, and the pairing of Dern and Jandiroba for the interim title has generated very little fan interest.
